conclusion: Analyzing liquid flow through baffles to determine which container it will flow into.
Liquid will be released from points A, B, C, and D at the top and navigate through baffles to reach containers E or F.
Setup shows colored blocks at the top (A, B, C, D), various colored baffles in the middle, and two collection containers (E and F) at the bottom.
Liquid from point A (yellow) starts from the yellow block.
Yellow liquid travels downward.
Yellow liquid hits and flows along the red baffle.
Yellow liquid continues downward, interacting with several other baffles.
Yellow liquid eventually reaches the left side of the system.
Yellow liquid flows into container E.
Liquid from point B (mint/turquoise) starts from the mint/turquoise block.
Mint/turquoise liquid flows downward.
Mint/turquoise liquid interacts with multiple baffles in the middle section.
Mint/turquoise liquid creates a path that moves toward the left side.
Mint/turquoise liquid flows into container E.
Liquid from point C (pink) starts from the pink block.
Pink liquid flows downward.
Pink liquid interacts with baffles in the right-center area.
Pink liquid creates paths that eventually converge toward the left.
Pink liquid flows into container E.
Liquid from point D (blue) starts from the rightmost blue block.
Blue liquid flows straight downward initially.
Blue liquid interacts with baffles primarily on the right side.
Blue liquid creates a path that leads to the left side.
Blue liquid flows into container E.
Final image shows all colored liquids (yellow, turquoise, pink, and blue) creating flow paths that converge toward the left side.
